item.title: Stablecoin Push Gains Ground in China in New Challenge to US
item.description: China faces growing calls from policy advisers and economists to explore using stablecoins for cross-border payments, as the US moves to entrench the dollar’s dominance through the still-emerging technology.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Yujing Liu, Heng Xie

media:content.media:description: The Paxos website on a laptop computer arranged in the Brooklyn borough of New York, US, on Tuesday, Feb. 14, 2023. The New York State Department of Financial Services said it had directed Paxos Trust Co. to stop issuing new tokens of crypto's third largest stablecoin, a Binance-branded coin known as BUSD that has roughly $16 billion in circulation.

item.title: Trump Says Israel Agreed to Terms for 60-Day Gaza Ceasefire
item.description: President Donald Trump said Israel has agreed to the conditions needed for a 60-day ceasefire in Gaza, adding that the plan would now be presented to Hamas.
item.dc:creator: Derek Wallbank

media:content.media:description: Palestinians carry sacks of flour from an aid distribution point in Beit Lahia, northern Gaza, on Tuesday, June 17, 2025. Some of Israel’s closest European allies, including Germany, the UK and France, have grown increasingly critical of its prosecution of the war, which has destroyed much of the coastal strip and sparked what international aid agencies say is a hunger crisis.

item.title: Starmer Emerges From UK Welfare Fight Weaker and Billions in Red
item.description: Keir Starmer dramatically abandoned his flagship welfare reforms to avoid a historic defeat, leaving the UK prime minister’s authority badly damaged and his government facing a widening fiscal hole to fill.
item.dc:creator: Joe Mayes, Lucy White, Ailbhe Rea

media:content.media:description: Keir Starmer, UK prime minister, during a meeting with Dick Schoof, Netherlands' prime minister, not pictured, at 10 Downing Street in London, UK, on Thursday, Feb. 6, 2025. The closer the Labour government aligns the British economy with the EU's — as it promised to do in July's election — the less room it has for maneuver to accommodate US demands on trade.

item.title: Senate Tax Bill Strikes Clean Energy But Leaves Room for Relief
item.description: The Senate version of President Donald Trump’s tax-and-spending bill would soften the blow for wind and solar developers, which had feared a sharp reduction in subsidies that helped spur a renewable power boom in the past few years. But the bill now faces conservatives in the House of Representatives eager to kill those credits.

item.title: Trump Tax Bill Hits Republican Resistance in House Ahead of Vote

media:content.media:description: Representative Jim McGovern, a Democrat from Massachusetts and ranking member of the House Rules Committee, center left, speaks during a hearing at the US Capitol in Washington, DC, US, on Tuesday, July 1, 2025. Donald Trump’s $3.3 trillion tax and spending cut bill passed the Senate Tuesday after a furious push by Republican leaders to persuade holdouts to back the legislation and hand the president a political win.
